asteroidsFX

Class Star

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.Parent
        • javafx.scene.Group
          • asteroidsFX.Star
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget

    public final class Star
extends javafx.scene.Group
    A star is a single point of light in the background

        The Shape of the footprint

        public void moveTo(double xTopLeft,
                   double yTopLeft)
        Move the sprite to a new X,Y (TopLeft)
        Parameters:
        xTopLeft - The X coordinate of the desired location
        yTopLeft - The Y coordinate of the desired location

        public void checkBounds()
        Check if the sprite is out of bounds, and wrap to the other side of the screen if so.

        Move the sprite on it's set path and velocity.

      • calcXY

        public void calcXY(LocationEnum locE,
                   double x,
                   double y)
        Calculate XY coordinates for all locations on the sprite based one one set.
        Parameters:
        locE - The LocationEnum that says where the x and y refer to
        x - The x coord
        y - The y coord

      • setXYBasedOnCenter

        public void setXYBasedOnCenter(double x,
                               double y)
        Calculate XY coordinates assuming we are given x,y for center.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coord
        y - The y coord

        public void setXYBasedOnTopLeft(double x,
                                double y)
        Calculate XY coordinates assuming we are given x,y for top-left.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coord
        y - The y coord

      • setXYBasedOnBottomCenter

        public void setXYBasedOnBottomCenter(double x,
                                     double y)
        Calculate XY coordinates assuming we are given x,y for bottom-center.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coord
        y - The y coord

      • getAngleFacing

        public double getAngleFacing()
        Simple getter of what angle the sprite in pointing to
        Returns:
        Angle in degrees. '0' is 12 o'clock. Can be negative.

      • setAngleFacing

        public void setAngleFacing(double angle)
        Set the angle the sprite should be pointing to.
        Parameters:
        angle - Angle in degrees. '0' is 12 o'clock. Can be negative.

      • startDeath

        public void startDeath()
        Start the death process. Start death animations, sounds, spawns, housekeeping, etc.

      • finishDeath

        public void finishDeath()
        Finish the death process. Finally terminate the object.

      • isDying

        public boolean isDying()
        A simple getter
        Returns:
        If the sprite is in the process of dying but not dead yet.

      • isDead

        public boolean isDead()
        A simple getter
        Returns:
        If the sprite is considered dead and ready for clean-up.

      • setSpeed

        public void setSpeed(double sSpeed)
        A simple setter which also calculates velocity too.
        Parameters:
        sSpeed - The distance in points the sprite will move per frame.

      • getCenterX

        public double getCenterX()
        A simple getter
        Returns:
        The current X position of the sprite.

        public double getCenterY()
        A simple getter
        Returns:
        The current Y position of the sprite.

        A simple getter

        The current X position of the sprite.

        A simple getter

        The current Y position of the sprite.

      • getRadius

        public double getRadius()
        A simple getter
        Returns:
        The current radius of the sprite.

      • getSizeX

        public double getSizeX()
        A simple getter
        Returns:
        The current X size of the sprite.

      • getSizeY

        public double getSizeY()
        A simple getter
        Returns:
        The current Y size of the sprite.

      • hitByRadius

        public boolean hitByRadius(asteroidsFX.Sprite target)
        Does the math to see if this sprite collides with another. Compared to hitByIntersect, this method is less accurate for non-circle shapes, but much quicker
        Parameters:
        target - The Enemy object to check
        Returns:
        True/False if it IS a hit.

      • hitByIntersect

        public boolean hitByIntersect(asteroidsFX.Sprite target)
        Does the math to see if this sprite collides with another. Compared to hitByRadius, this method is more accurate for non-circle shapes, but much slower
        Parameters:
        target - The Enemy object to check
        Returns:
        True/False if it IS a hit.

      • setPause

        public void setPause(boolean sPause)
        Sets pause or unpause
        Parameters:
        sPause - True for paused, False for unpaused

      • getPause

        public boolean getPause()
        Get pause or unpause
        Returns:
        True for paused, False for unpaused
